intro: Rhynchoglossum scabrum, commonly known as the rough-stemmed rhynchoglossum, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features rough, hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its common name. Its flowers are usually yellow or brown, and it produces small, elongated fruits known as achenes. Rhynchoglossum scabrum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
